definition: lucky star in the ascendant (idiom); a lucky sign
good fortune/happiness/luck
surname Fu/abbr. for Fujian province 福建省[Fu2 jian4 sheng3]
star/heavenly body/satellite/small amount
high/tall/above average/loud/your (honorific)
surname Gao
according to/in accordance with/to shine/to illuminate/to reflect/to look at (one's reflection)/to take (a photo)/photo/as requested/as before

sentences.english: I am very proud to be discussing you this evening.
sentences.chinese: 今天能跟你談話真是我福星高照。

sentences.english: My father was born under a lucky star.
The next big belly of spring back luck, a face of tired.
sentences.chinese: 翌日腹大便便的春花回到福星高照，一臉倦容。

sentences.english: Suddenly, min jung came into, yelling cooperation should be terminated with luck.
sentences.chinese: 忽然，都敏俊闖進來，大嚷要跟福星高照終止合作。

sentences.english: I'll only believe my good luck when you come out through those doors.
sentences.chinese: 等你從門裏走出來的時候，我只能相信我是福星高照。

sentences.english: Good luck in the year ahead .
sentences.chinese: 祝在新的一年裏福星高照。

definition: everything is going smoothly (idiom)
profits pouring in from all sides (idiom)/raking in money/bonanza
the time comes, fortune turns (idiom); to have a lucky break/things change for the better
flood of good fortune fills the heavens (idiom); a lucky sign
variant of 紅運|红运[hong2 yun4]
to experience good luck
god of wealth
to climb step by step/to rise steadily/on the up and up
mascot/lucky star
god of wealth/very wealthy man
lit. (may the) five blessings descend upon this home (namely: longevity, wealth, health, virtue, and a natural death)/(an auspicious saying for the Lunar New Year)
lit. gold and jade fill the hall (idiom)/fig. abundant wealth/abundance of knowledge
good luck
misfortune turns to blessing (idiom); to turn an inauspicious start to good account
our luck is in, everything is going smoothly (idiom)
joy from heaven (idiom); overjoyed at unexpected good news/unlooked-for happy event
